content: The "Senior Tax Relief Act of 1999" repeals the 1993 increase in tax on Social Security benefits. The "Senior Tax Relief Act of 1999" repeals the 1993 increase in tax on Social Security benefits. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and Social Security Amendments of 1983 are made, affecting taxable years after December 31, 1998. The amendments made by the "Senior Tax Relief Act of 1999" apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1998, including changes to section 121(e) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. SEC. 3. Removal of limitation on outside income for Social Security beneficiaries receiving benefits. Repeal of provisions related to deductions for work under the Social Security Act, including subsections (b), (c)(1), (d), (f), (h), (j), and (k) of section 203. Conforming amendments are made to section 203, redesignating subsection (c) as subsection (b) and making adjustments to paragraphs within the section. The text chunk involves amendments to subsections in a legislative document, including redesignating subsections and making conforming adjustments. The text chunk includes amendments to subsections in the Social Security Act, specifically related to benefits terminated upon deportation and exemptions from reductions based on early retirement. Amendments involve redesignating subsections and making conforming adjustments. Amendments to subsections in the Social Security Act include changes related to exemptions from reductions based on certain entitlements to child's insurance benefits and suspension of aliens' benefits. Amendments to various sections of the Social Security Act include changes such as striking certain subsections and inserting new ones to adjust benefit calculations and penalties for misrepresentations concerning earnings. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve adjustments to benefit calculations, penalties for earnings misrepresentations, and provisions for determining substantial gainful activity. Amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to benefit calculations, penalties for earnings misrepresentations, and defining income for SSI purposes. The amendment to the Social Security Act clarifies the definition of wages for paragraph (1)(A) without certain limitations on remuneration specified in section 209(a). It also includes provisions for services not considered employment under section 210 and excludes specific amounts from the term 'wages'. The amendment clarifies the definition of wages for Social Security Act, excluding certain payments related to retirement. It also repeals deductions under the Railroad Retirement Act. Effective for taxable years ending on or after a specified date. The section applies to taxable years ending on or after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 4 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 repeals estate and gift taxes, effective for estates of decedents dying after the enactment of this Act.
